sentences.en: ...the nomination of Texas Senator Lloyd Bentsen to be treasury secretary.
sentences.cn: …德克萨斯州议员劳埃德·本特森作财政部长的任命。

sentences.en: All the committee’s nominations were approved.
sentences.cn: 该委员会的所有提名均获得批准。

sentences.en: Does she have enough prestige to win the nomination?
sentences.cn: 她有足够的威望赢得提名 吗 ?

sentences.en: Few people pronounced for his nomination.
sentences.cn: 很少人表示赞成他的提名.

sentences.en: He knew the nomination was his for the asking.
sentences.cn: 他知道只要他开口就能得到那项提名。

sentences.en: He remembered the fact that his nomination had not been unanimous.
sentences.cn: 他想起他被提名并不是一致通过的.

sentences.en: I have a nomination at your service.
I will make out the nomination for your signature as you direct.
sentences.cn: 我将照着您的吩咐,拟就任命的文件请您来签署.

sentences.en: Obviously, Roosevelt was feeling his way and assuring his nomination in 1904.
sentences.cn: 虽然罗斯福正在摸索自己的道路,并为1904年总统提名作准备.

sentences.en: On the death of Leo there were two main candidates for nomination as his replacement.
sentences.cn: 利奥去世后，有两个主要候选人被指定来接替他。

sentences.en: She expected to achieve the requisite two - thirds majority for nomination.
sentences.cn: 她期望得到获得提名所必需的三分之二多数.

sentences.en: She won an Oscar nomination for best supporting actress.
sentences.cn: 她获得奥斯卡奖最佳女配角的提名.

sentences.en: The film —tautly directed by horror-meister Sam Raimi —is almost assured an Oscar nomination.
sentences.cn: 这部由恐怖片大师萨姆·莱米倾力执导的影片几乎可以稳拿奥斯卡提名奖。

sentences.en: The film faces stiff competition for the Best Film nomination.
sentences.cn: 这部电影在角逐最佳影片提名时面临着激烈的竞争。

sentences.en: They opposed the nomination of a junior officer to the position of Inspector General of Police.
sentences.cn: 他们反对任命一名下级警官担任警务总监。

sentences.en: They say he's certain to get a nomination for best supporting actor.
sentences.cn: 他们说他肯定能获得最佳男配角奖的提名。

words.tran_cn: 主格的；记名的；被提名的
被任命者；被提名的人；代名人

trans.tran_en: the act of giving someone a particular job, or the fact of being given that job
